thread.title: BMC Elections 2017: Mumbai witnesses voter turnaround of 52.17%
thread.title_full: BMC Elections 2017: Mumbai witnesses voter turnaround of 52.17%

author: FE Online
title: BMC Elections 2017: Mumbai witnesses voter turnaround of 52.17%
text:
BMC Elections 2017: Mumbai witnesses voter turnaround of 52.17% BMC Elections 2017: Mumbai witnesses voter turnaround of 52.17% BMC Polls 2017: Former Indian cricketer and Rajya Sabha MP Sachin Tendulkar also cast his vote, along with his wife Anjali. By: FE Online | New Delhi | Published: February 21, 2017 8:19 PM BMC Polls 2017: Polling for 227 seats of Municipal Corporation of Greater Mumbai continued till 6 pm. (Source: Twitter) 
Despite regular appeals by the candidates and well-meaning residents of Brihanmumbai to the electorate to cast their votes, the turnout was low but better than the last time. Final turnout was reported at 52.17% when the polling stopped at 6 PM. Even though this is not a new trend and Mumbaikars are known for their apathy, this time over a lot of efforts were made to have a bigger voter turnout. Chief Minister, Devendra Fadnavis made fervent appeals to the residents to come in large numbers and exercise their right to vote. 
Udhav Thackeray also made appeals to come and vote, but the residents have kept true to the earlier trend. In 2012, it was 44%. 100 names were also found missing from the voter’s list.For instance, Varun Dhawan, the actor and BJP member, Shaina NC had their names missing from the voter’s list. 
Polling for 227 seats of Municipal Corporation of Greater Mumbai continued till 6 pm, where a total of 17,331 candidates are in the fray for 3,210 seats in 10 municipal corporations. The civic body polls witnessed voters from political, Bollywood and sports fraternity. 
Also Watch: 
However, Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis and Shiv Sena Party chief Uddhav Thackeray were among the many who cast their votes. Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray also cast his vote earlier in the day. The Bollywood fraternity including Anushka Sharma, John Abraham, Ranveer Singh, Shraddha Kapoor, Varun Dhawan, veteran actress Rekha, director Subhash Ghai also stepped out to cast their vote. 
Former Indian cricketer and Rajya Sabha MP Sachin Tendulkar also cast his vote, along with his wife Anjali. The local body polls will be witnessing a high pitch battle between the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), the Shiv Sena, the Congress , the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena and the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP). Police had beefed up security across the city ahead of the polls and are maintaining a strong vigil to avert any untoward incident across the 7,304 polling centres. In fact, the authorities had made all effort to make it easy for the residents to check their name on the voter’s list.. voters were put on the websites so that tech savvy Mumbaikars could come and vote without difficulty. Government offices were closed to enable the resident to vote. It was important to vote for the Mumbaikars as it would decide the fate of allies.
